request.description:
**Endpoint**: POST /Security

**Description**: Returns Session

**FULL URL**: [http://api.adempiere.io](http://api.adempiere.io/api)/security/login

**Method**: POST

**Parameters (Body)**

user_name (String, Mandatory)

user_pass (String, Mandatory)

role_id (Int32, Optional)

organization_id (Int32, Optional)

warehose_id (Int32, Optional)

language (String, Optional)

client_version (String, Optional)

**Application Example**

``` bash
curl --location 'http://api.adempiere.io/security/login' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--header 'Authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJqdGkiOiIxMDAwMTQ2IiwiQURfQ2xpZW50X0lEIjoxMSwiQURfT3JnX0lEIjowLCJBRF9Sb2xlX0lEIjoxMDIsIkFEX1VzZXJfSUQiOjEwMCwiTV9XYXJlaG91c2VfSUQiOjAsIkFEX0xhbmd1YWdlIjoiZXNfTVgiLCJpYXQiOjE3MTA2Mjg3ODAsImV4cCI6MTcxMDcxNTE4MH0.8Sg48hnxmTbqs7nG_JoafC7AwXbHX3jWAPLPJ0Qo7VU' \
--data '{
    "user_name": "SuperUser",
    "user_pass": "System",
    "role_id":5,
    "organization_id":1,
    "warehouse_id":1,
    "language": "es",
    "client_version":"qwe"
}'

 ```

**Example Answer**

``` json
{
    "token": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJqdGkiOiIxMDAwMTQ5IiwiQURfQ2xpZW50X0lEIjoxMSwiQURfT3JnX0lEIjo1MDAwNiwiQURfUm9sZV9JRCI6MTAyLCJBRF9Vc2VyX0lEIjoxMDAsIk1fV2FyZWhvdXNlX0lEIjo1MDAwNiwiQURfTGFuZ3VhZ2UiOiJlbl9VUyIsImlhdCI6MTcxMDY5NTEzMiwiZXhwIjoxNzEwNzgxNTMyfQ.1x2cSgxJMwhoVQVbdp2s7piA6qQMCNUzLYxiLAS-I-8"
}

 ```

**Common mistakes**

- username or password has an invalid value
    

```
{
    "code": 13,
    "message": "User/Contact / Role / Organization * Not found *",
    "details": []
}

 ```

**Change control**

| **Version** | date | author | Description of Changes |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 1.0 | 15/03/2024 | Ricardo | Initial creation of the document. |

**Endpoint**: GET /Security

**Description**: Returns UserInfo

**FULL URL**: [http://api.adempiere.io](http://api.adempiere.io/api)/security/user-info

**Method**: GET

**Application Example**

``` bash
curl --location 'http://api.adempiere.io/security/user-info' \
--header 'Authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJqdGkiOiIxMDAwMTQ2IiwiQURfQ2xpZW50X0lEIjoxMSwiQURfT3JnX0lEIjowLCJBRF9Sb2xlX0lEIjoxMDIsIkFEX1VzZXJfSUQiOjEwMCwiTV9XYXJlaG91c2VfSUQiOjAsIkFEX0xhbmd1YWdlIjoiZXNfTVgiLCJpYXQiOjE3MTA2Mjg3ODAsImV4cCI6MTcxMDcxNTE4MH0.8Sg48hnxmTbqs7nG_JoafC7AwXbHX3jWAPLPJ0Qo7VU'

 ```

**Example Answer**

``` json
{
    "id": 100,
    "uuid": "a4bd438e-fb40-11e8-a479-7a0060f0aa01",
    "value": "SuperUser",
    "name": "SuperUser",
    "description": "Super User with Access to all levels",
    "comments": "",
    "image": "",
    "connection_timeout": "86400000"
}

 ```

| **Version** | date | author | Description of Changes |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 1.0 | 15/03/2024 | Ricardo | Initial creation of the document. |


**Example Answer**

``` json
"id": 0,
    "uuid": "",
 ```

                                "name": "Client",
                                "description": "Maintain Clients/Tenants",
                                "help": "The Client is the highest level of an independent business entity.  Each Client will have one or more Organizations reporting to it.  Each Client defines the accounting parameters (Accounting Schema, Tree definition, Non Monetary UOM's). To create new Clients, run the Initial Client Setup with the System Administrator Role.\nDo not create a new client in this window, but use \"Initial Client Setup\" to set up the required security and access rules. If you create a new client here, you will not be able to view it and also the required client infrastructure would not have been set up."

                                "name": "Merge Entities",
                                "description": "Merge From Entity to To Entity - Delete From",
                                "help": "<i>Dangerous - Please are aware of what you are doing!</i>\nAll instances of the From entity (e.g. Customer A) are changed to the To entity (e.g. Customer B). \nThe From entity (e.g. Customer A) is deleted. \n<p><b>There is NO undo nor trace !  Please do a backup first</b> Please be aware that you may be changing history records (e.g. invoices, etc.) ! </p>\n<p><b>Side effects:</b> Merging Products are likely to distort product costs; Merging Business Partners may result in incorrect open item balance. Check with support on remedies.\n<p><b>Restrictions:</b> Accounting and Inventory conflicts are not resolved in this version."
                            },

                                        "help": "Data Replication allows you to synchronize data of remote instances with a central office.                         "help": "This process will synchronize all tables and columns that are new or have changes since the last synchronization was performed.                             "workflow": {
                                "id": 112,
                                "uuid": "a526570c-fb40-11e8-a479-7a0060f0aa01",
                                "name": "Performance Measurement Setup",
                                "description": "Setup your Performance Measurement",
                                "help": "This workflow guides you through setting up your performance measurement based on Key Performance Indicators, Balanced Scorecard, etc.\n\nMost important: Do your analysis first!\n- What are your goals and how do you measure it?\n\nWhen you are setting up the system, you do it in reverse:\nFirst you define how you measure it and last you define the goals for the measurements.\nYou have three ways measuring performance:\n- via quantifiable measures (e.g. sales of $3 million in Q1)\n- via manual measures\n- via achievements (tasks)\n\nThe system converts the measures into percentages (based on the target and achieved measure - or number of total and reached achievements)"
                            },
                            "children": []
                        },

                                "name": "Performance Color Schema",
                                "description": "Maintain Performance Color Schema",
                                "help": "Visual representation of performance by color.  The Schema has often three levels (e.g. red-yellow-green).  Adempiere support two levels (e.g. red-green) or four levels (e.g. gray-bronce-silver-gold).  Note that Measures without a goal are represented white.  The percentages could be beween 0 and unlimited (i.e. above 100%)."
                            },

                                    "name": "MRP Notice",
                                    "description": "View MRP Notices",
                                    "is_active": true,
                                    "is_summary": false,
                                    "is_sales_transaction": false,
                                    "is_read_only": false,
                                    "action": "W",
                                    "window": {
                                        "id": 53008,
                                        "uuid": "a521e348-fb40-11e8-a479-7a0060f0aa01",
                                        "name": "MRP Notice",
                                        "description": "View MRP Notices",
                                        "help": "The system creates messages while performing processes. In this window you can view them.\n\nMRP Notice\nIt is a group of messages generated for the MRP process. It indicates to the scheduler the actions he needs to do to reach the Master Production Schedule. The action messages are set as notices for the planner when he sign up the Compiere session.\n\nThe possible action messages are:\n\nMRP Code\t Action Message\nMRP - 001\t Beginning Quantity Less Than Zero.\nMRP - 020\t Create - A Supply Order should be created to satisfy a negative projected on hand balance.\nThis message is only generate if Create Plan is No or if a new requirement appears the time fence.\n\nMRP - 030\t De Expedite - Indicates that a scheduled supply order is due before it is needed\nand should be delayed, or demand rescheduled to an earlier date.\n\nMRP - 040\t Expedite - Indicates that a scheduled supply order is due after is needed\nand should be rescheduled to an earlier date, or demand rescheduled to a later date.\n\nMRP - 050\t Cancel - Indicate that a scheduled supply order is no longer needed and should be deleted.\nMRP - 060\t Release Due For - Indicate that a schedule order should be released.\nMRP - 070\t Release Past Due For - Indicate that a supply order was not released when it was due,\nand should be either released or expedited now, or the demand rescheduled for a later date.\n\nMRP - 080\t Quantity Less than Minimum - Indicates that a supply order was created for\na quantity less than the minimum quantity set in the product planning\n\nMRP - 090\t Quantity Less than Maximum - Indicates that a supply order was created for a quantity\nfor a quantity greater than than maximum quantity set in the product planning\n\nMRP - 100\t Past Due Time Fence - Indicates that there is an unsatisfied material requirement inside\nthe planning time fence for this item. You should either manually schedule and expedite orders to\n\nfill this demand or delay fulfillment of the requirement that created the demand.\n\nMRP - 110\t No exists Dem"
                                    },
                                    "children": []
                                },
                                {

                                    "uuid": "8e506f72-fb40-11e8-a479-7a0060f0aa01",
